The Lantanna organize their leadership into a council named the Ayrorch which is led by an Ayrar and composed of other eleven members known as Santar who, upon the death of the Ayrar, elect a new Governmentr.
The Santar are responsible for picking a new Governmentr for the nation of Lantan.

A Hathran, in the Rashemi tongue, means "learned sister". Though equally respected as their elder Othlors, a Hathran has many more years to learn the trade, and consequently, the wisdom to influence politics.
Though the Wychlaran deal with their own recruiting, it is not unheard of to suggest a promising young lady of Rashemen, with a magical aptitude.
Among the Rashemi, the witches of the Wychlaran are the supreme arbiters of who gets to Government and only men are able to be elected to such positions.
Resembling humans with more delicate features, spirit folk are the mystical descendants of humans and nature spirits and thus more attuned to the natural world itself.

The devils of Baator have a great interest in corrupting and conquering the Prime Material Plane both for the souls they can harvest from it as well as a new staging area in the Blood War. To that end, they offer great power to mortals willing to serve their cause.

Fiends are evil outsiders and as such their forms of organization are often alien to the inhabitants of Toril. When they invade, they often rally behind a strong leader and care little as to what kind of mortal settlements they conquer as long as they are able to do so.

Illithids, or Mind Flayers, are aberrations of seemingly unknown origin. They possess incredible psionic powers, which they use to enslave most creatures who cross their path. Physically, they resemble a human with an octopus-like head.

An ulitharid is in all ways a bigger, stronger, nastier mind flayer. It towers over other illithids, and it is also smarter, worse-tempered, and much more dangerous than its smaller kin. Fortunately, ulitharids are also quite rare.
The Lotus Emperor of Yikaria is also the high priest of the Faceless God and is doomed to be sacrificed after exactly 20 years of service.

The Yakfolk of Yikaria are Governmentd by a theocratic priest-emperor empowered by the Faceless God himself. The Lotus Emperor forsakes his own name and after twenty years of Government becomes himself a sacrifice to the Faceless God.
Use your powers, be they magic of psionic, to ensure total loyalty.

Moander was an ancient deity of rot, corruption and decay. The Darkbringer has never had a large following, but was worshipped since before the rise of Netheril. Moander was also notable for appearing with varying genders in their many appearances. Moander was a cruel and controlling tyrant, relishing in tormenting and destroying mortals.

This area is partially phased into the Feywild, and thus possesses many attributes of the Faerie Realm.
Illithids, or mind flayers, have their own special mechanics that affect how they play significantly. These mechanics are ceremorphosis and mind control. Which would you like to learn about?

Ceremorphosis is a targeted decision that allows you to create a new heir from a prisoner. The prisoner must be a human, half-human, elf, orc or goblinoid of less than 70 years of age (unless they are an elf or gith). This has a chance of failure and costs piety (scaling with how many heirs you have).

Mind control is a decision that can target any of your vassals or courtiers as long as they are not illithids or yikarians. It costs both piety and prestige, but makes the target utterly loyal to you for 10 years.
Wizards have unique mechanics that you may want to know about. These mechanics control how they cast and acquire their spells. What would you like to learn about?

In order to access spells other than the universal ones you must choose a school of magic to specialize in. Each, except Wild Magic, has opposed schools whose spells you can't learn and will give you a set of spells of that school. Wild Magic will instead grant you a single unique spell plus a few spells from other schools.

To cast a spell, you must expend spell points, which are displayed in a modifier on your character. Spell points are determined based on your learning and wizard level. These refresh, and are recalculated, once a year.

In order to get new spells, you must research them via a decision that costs gold (scaled on your income). You are guaranteed to learn one new spell, though the time it takes may vary. You can't learn spells from opposing schools.
Some realms and religions have a dim view on arcane magic and may seek to regulate or even outlaw its use. In realms where it is outlawed, arcane casters can even be imprisoned by the local rulers.
Whenever a wild mage casts any spell, there is a chance that the spell will go haywire in a wild surge, which can cause a host of different effects, some novel, some potentially lethal.
Tutorial events will fire for you when starting the game or accessing new mechanics.

Holy Wars in Faerûn work differently than in the base game. A character can declare a holy war on others based on their religion and/or patron trait. This means that sometimes you can even declare a holy war on someone of your own religion.\n\nWho you can war against is detailed in either the patron trait or religion description.

It seems that defeating the Scoured Legion and their fortress of Hellgate Keep has had unintended consequences. The siege of Hellgate has disrupted the magic of an ancient, long-forgotten elven prison. Now the prisoners, the Fey'ri of House Dlardrageth, have broken free and have already bolstered their forces with summoned demons in order to claim Hellgate for themselves.

Though the demonic Scoured Legion has been defeated and driven off of their stronghold of Hellgate Keep, a new threat has arisen. Deep beneath Hellgate lies a long-forgotten prison, whose ancient magic was disrupted by the Scoured Legion's defeat. Now its prisoners, the Daemonfey, have been unleashed upon the world.

Goliaths are a large humanoid race that may be related to giants. They are quite competitive and strive to constantly improve themselves. At the same time, they hold great disgust for any who are seen as not carrying their own weight.
Though the Shoon Imperium is long gone, an ambitious enough ruler might be able to restore its glory once more.

Though the Shoon Imperium fell long ago to both external pressures and internal corruption, the dream of the largest human empire in western Faerûn has never faded. And now, thanks to you, it is a dream no longer.
We must restore the old legacy!
In an unexpected twist, [From.GetBestName] has revived the Shoon Imperium of old. What this means for the future of Faerûn remains to be seen.
Must hold at least two of the following kingdoms: Calimshan, Tethyr, or Amn
Theocracies are religious realms controlled by spiritual leaders and who, in theory, put their faith first and foremost in most matters.
Minor theocracies, like minor republics, are unplayable. Rulers are appointed or elected from among the ecclesiarchy, and there is no dynastic persistence between generations of rulers.

Those who follow the Enlightened faiths of Zakhara follow a special form of governance prescribed the tenets of their religions, which set them apart from the so-called 'savages' who do not recognize the primacy of Fate.
Pick a Beast Totem through which you'll worship Uthgar.

Uthgar is an unique god in that he demands that his followers worship him using his Beast Totems, great beasts that he vanquished while still a mortal, as intermediaries. All Uthgardt must choose one, and it will define many aspects of their religious life.

By the ancient Uthgardt tradition, each tribe should be held by those who follow its associated Beast Totem. You, however, have violated this tradition and will incur the wrath of your fellow uthgardt until you correct the situation.
This character is holding a tribe of a different Beast Totem
A non-capital county in your demesne will be given to the restored tribe. If you are a king or emperor, they will be vassalized. If you only have one county, the title will be destroyed.

Runemeet is the most important of Uthgar's holy days, where the tribes converge upon Beorunna's Well in order to perform initiations, send raids against mountain orcs, and establish relations with each other.
Having chosen to attend this year's Runemeet, you make your preparations for the journey to Beorunna's well.

You arrive at Beorunna's Well, the holiest site of the Uthgardt and place where the legendary warrior Beorunna defeated the demon Zukothoth. You can see that many of the tribes have already arrayed themselves around the Well and are getting ready for the festivities.
Take part in the year's Runehunt.
Use the opportunity to increase relations with other tribes.

This year's Runemeet has come to an end, and you head back home to your realm. Regardless of what you chose to do during this year, the coming year will always allow for you to participate in a different part of the event.

The Runehunt is a ritual raid where youths seeking to become adults, as well as any adult warriors seeking more glory, conduct an attack on the mountain orc tribes endemic to The North. It is a holy ceremony, but not one without risks.

After a few days of tracking, you've finally come upon your prey: a sizable warband of orcs on the march. The battle horns are sounded and the host you are a part of starts to charge the orcish enemy.
You fight ferociously and show the orcs the strength of the Uthgardt. As you return to Beorunna's Well your fellow warriors praise your skill in battle.

You fight ferociously and show the orcs the strength of the Uthgardt. During the battle, you feel overcome by a bestial rage and tear through the enemy. As you return to Beorunna's Well your fellow warriors dub you a berseker.

You fight ferociously, but during the fighting an orc manages to break through your defences and wound you. Despite this, you still win and as you return to Beorunna's Well your fellow warriors praise your skill in battle.

You fight ferociously, but during the fighting an orc manages to break through your defences. The blow he inflicts upon you is grievous indeed and you fall to the ground, life leaving your body. You pass away before the battle is finished.
You decide to use this year's Runemeet to try and establish better relations with the rest of the tribes. Fortunately for you, you manage to impress them and now you are viewed more favourably.

You decide to use this year's Runemeet to try and establish better relations with the rest of the tribes. Unfortunately, however, you have made the opposite impression and now the tribes see you as untrustworthy.
I must've misspoke at some point.

You decide to use this year's Runemeet to try and establish better relations with the rest of the tribes. Your efforts this year, however, end up being in vain and you've failed to make an impression on the tribes.
[This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] became renowned after doing what many though unthinkable: to revive the Shoon Imperium, the greatest human realm in western Faerûn.
In the arcane dynastic succession, only members of the ruling dynasty can inherit, but the heir is elected from amongst the family based on magical prowes.
In wizard elective realms, only wizards can inherit and are elected by their peers with little regard to dynastic lines.
The Red Wizards of Thay elect their leader from the holders of the Zulkirates, one for each school of wizardly magic.
In the divine dynastic succession, only members of the ruling dynasty can inherit, but the heir is elected from amongst the family based on piety and holyness.
In cleric elective realms, only clerics can inherit and are elected by their peers with little regard to dynastic lines.
In druid elective realms, only clerics can inherit and are elected by their peers with little regard to dynastic lines.
Abjuration is the school of arcane magic that encompasses defensive spells and negating the advantages of others.
Conjuration is the school of arcane magic that deals with the summoning of both energy and creatures from other planes.
Divination is the school of arcane magic that reveals secrets, both past and future.
Enchantment is the school of arcane magic that allows one to control the minds of others.
Evocation is the school of arcane magic that concerns itself with the manipulation of energy, usually for offence.
Illusion is the school of arcane magic whose spells deceive the senses of others.
Necromancy is the school of arcane magic with spells that control life and death, as well as controlling the undead.
Transmutation is the school of arcane magic that allows for controlling and altering the physical properties of objects and creatures.

It took a lot of searching and money, but finally you have the materials necessary for the ritual of Longevity. Once complete, it will enable you to live far longer than most your people are able to. The rituals is exhausting, but as it completes...

There are some paths to immortality, but for necromancers the easiest one is lichdom. Assembling a phylactery was expensive, not to mention risky since there are those who simply do not understand. Yet, everything is ready and you can perform the ritual.
I shall tread the path of the archlich.
